item.title: Demand Pump Selector – ON Position One or Two Inoperative

numlitem.para: Verify AUTO and OFF function of the associated demand pump are operative, and

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:

placard.para: Placard the associated Demand Pump Selector ON Position switch(es): "ON POS INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

warning.para: ENSURE THAT PERSONNEL AND EQUIPMENT ARE CLEAR OF ALL FLIGHT CONTROL SURFACES.

numlitem.para: After engine start for affected pump, verify that associated system pressure with Engine Driven Pump (EDP) OFF and Demand Pump in AUTO position is 2800-3200 psi. Verify after turning Demand pump to OFF, that associated system pressure decreases to less than 500 psi. Reselect EDP ON and Demand Pump to AUTO.
For demand pumps 1 and/or 4, verify the auto control of the ADP continuous solenoid functions properly:
Select the Hydraulic Synoptic page for display on EICAS. Verify the associated ADP is not operating.

With the Flaps Up, select Flaps 1 while monitoring ADP run status on the synoptic display. Verify the ADP starts to operate upon selecting Flaps 1. If the ADP does not start, it must be considered inoperative and deferred per MEL item 29-11-2-1.
